about_paragraph10_text: IATI is funding current development. If you are interested in funding part of the ongoing development of d-portal, or specific pieces of future development, please contact support@iatistandard.org
about_paragraph11_text: The open source concept relies on sharing resources in the hopes that others will join in and build a better platform together. This includes finding and reporting bugs, contributing new features that you'd like the platform to have or even creating new themes so that others may use it.
about_paragraph12_text: Other sites based on d-portal will be listed below, get in touch to add yours!
about_paragraph14_text: 1. Where do resources come from?2. Where do they go (by sector and location)?
about_paragraph15_text: Recent, current and future data is presented and compared across data sources.
about_paragraph1_text: d-portal.org helps you explore IATI data by providing a search function and information by country or by organisation on development activities and budgets published to the platform.
about_paragraph2_text: It is aimed at providing line ministries, parliamentarians and civil society in developing countries with information that can assist with the planning and monitoring of development activities.
about_paragraph3_text: d-portal contains current data published to the International Aid Transparency Initiative (IATI) as well as the most recent year's data available in the OECD DAC Creditor Reporting System.
about_paragraph4_text: The current platform poses two questions:
about_paragraph5_text: In order to answer these questions from a country perspective it is insufficient merely to display available data: it is equally important to show the gaps in the information. Coping with poor quality or missing data is an essential part of the information interface.
about_paragraph6_text: is an open source platform. This means you can use all aspects of the platform to build your own portal using the free source code.
about_paragraph7_text: While it currently provides a generic deployment for any country it has been developed with the specific intention of being customised in-country to meet local needs. For further information on how you could create a customised version for a specific country, see How to Install.
about_paragraph9_text: The initial development of d-portal.org which ran from Dec 2013 to the Global Partnership meeting in Mexico in April 2014 was funded by IATI and Development Initiatives (DI).
alert1_text: d-portal.org is still in beta. Thank you for your patience! Please provide any feedback
beige0: {beige_alert_text} {beige_alert_here_text}.
country_dropmenu_text: Type to search for a Recipient Country
dash_paragraph1_text: Dash is an overview of the data populating d-portal.org with a focus primarily on organisation statistics and the quality of the data reported by them.
dash_paragraph2_text: By showing you when and where invalid data is reported, Dash will be able to explain the gaps that are reflected on the main site.
dash_paragraph3_text: Dash is not country specific so you will be able to view all of the organisation statistics available across all countries included in the portal. This is to accommodate the fact that there are multiple organisations that report activities in multiple recipient countries.
discover_paragraph1_text: Backed by dstore and Q, Explore provides a simple interface for users to filter through the vast IATI database.
discover_paragraph2_text: We are always seeking feedback on the intuitiveness and usability of Explore. Send us your feedback by adding a new issue through the Github forum or, if you prefer, get in touch via email.
dlogs_paragraph1_text: Statistics & graphs of the d-portal database generated from nightly imports. This was created to track the increasing number of IATI activities and usage of IATI elements published to d-portal.
dquery_paragraph1_text: A read only SQL interface to the full database, dquery provides technical users access to all the IATI data populating d-portal and options to download the data in XML, JSON, HTML and CSV formats.
dquery_paragraph2_text: This new feature is still being tested and updated. Please get in touch if you have any questions or suggestions.
dstore_paragraph_text: dstore subsidises the IATI Registry with an optimized nodejs, PostgreSQL and SQLite version for use in real time queries.
explore_paragraph1_text: Pick a country or organisation below to explore their data.
explore_paragraph2_text: Only countries and organisations with data published to IATI are available for exploration.
faq_explore_a1_text:
EXPLORE is made up of two parts – a series of filters, and a freetext box.

1. Filters

These are a selection of filters relating to the IATI Standard allowing users to choose and refine the IATI data they want to explore.

2. Freetext

This is a freetext box allowing users to search for themes and topics, and specific activities published to IATI.
faq_explore_a2_text: The EXPLORE feature is on the front page of d-portal.org and helps users find activities published to the IATI Standard based on keywords - it was originally developed to help people who wanted to find information on specific humanitarian crises.
faq_explore_a3_text:
Select multiple filters from across the dropdowns. As you build a query using these filters the space underneath the filters will populate with an indication of how many activities are available to view based on your selections.

You can then click ‘Explore Results’ to find out more about those activities.
faq_explore_a4_text:
Recipient Country and Reporting Organisation

The organisations that have published to the IATI Standard, and the countries where funds have gone to as published within IATI data.

Sector Group and Sector

The numeric codes and names to describe sectors within the OECD DAC CRS, as used within the IATI Standard.

Activity Status

The numeric codes and names within the IATI activity status field.

Year Range

Years from 1960 to ‘present year + 2’.

More filters

The numeric codes and names within the IATI activity status field. Click on Glossary to find out more about individual filters.
faq_explore_a5_text:
Type in one or more keywords and press enter to see how many activities have been found.

Click ‘Explore Results’ to see lists, graphs and maps allowing further exploration of the data.

Refine your search by adding multiple words – e.g. ‘Hurricane Matthew’ will find more refined (fewer) results than ‘Hurricane’.
faq_explore_a6_text: Clicking ‘Explore Results’ provides results in the usual d-portal format (stats and charts which you can explore by clicking through to tables).
faq_explore_a7_text: This searches the Title and Description fields within all published IATI activities.
faq_explore_a8_text: EXPLORE is adapted for English plural nouns - e.g. typing ‘Refugee’ will include results for ‘Refugees’.
faq_explore_a9_text: The COVID-19 button follows the IATI Publishing Guidance. It currently searches the database for COVID-19 in title and description fields and looks for the relevant codes in the humanitarian-scope element.

faq_general_a11_text: See milestones on GitHub issues page or contact us at support@iatistandard.org
faq_general_a12_text:
See the About page.

Look at the issues on GitHub.

Contact us - support@iatistandard.org
faq_general_a13_text:
Data that is marked as invalid IATI xml when using the Validator.

Mismatch between ‘Identifier’ in organisation’s profile in the IATI Registry, and reporting-org in that organisation’s data – this will show zeroes in the organisation’s data until the two are matched.

Transaction type code not present.

Not using either Disbursements or Expenditure in transaction type field.

Country and Sector graphs are displayed by adding up Transaction type codes 3 (Disbursement) and 4 (Expenditure) so activities without transactions or the right transaction type codes will not have these graphs.

Dates in incorrect format in the data.

Activities without end date are not shown on the list of projects ending soon or any lists that need an end date to order them.

The map section will not be shown if there are no activities with longitude and latitude data.

Illogical dates such as activity end date before activity start date.

No data relevant to the year being viewed on a pie chart or table (eg where a pie chart shows 2024 data and data published only relates to 2023).

If updating your Registry profile only, changes will show after the weekly full import (each weekend) as d-portal only updates nightly the data that has been changed in the xml.
faq_general_a1_text: A view of all IATI (International Aid Transparency Initiative) data by recipient country or organisation, comparable with latest OECD DAC CRS (Creditor Reporting System) data.
faq_general_a2_text: IATI and CRS data (see below for more information).
faq_general_a3_text: The International Aid Transparency Initiative - IATI is a voluntary, multi-stakeholder initiative that seeks to improve the transparency of aid, development, and humanitarian resources in order to increase their effectiveness in tackling poverty.
faq_general_a4_text: The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development’s Development Assistance Committee Creditor Reporting System - which contains Official Development Assistance data.
faq_general_a5_text:
The IATI data comes from the IATI Registry.

The CRS data comes from CRS tables and stored on Github.
faq_general_a6_text:
Organisations report their IATI data at varying degrees of detail, and data is updated and improved all the time by reporting organisations. If an organisation only publishes data for 2023, it won’t appear in 2024 columns/charts etc.

d-portal attempts to only reflect what is in the data and does not make corrections to data or information published to IATI, with only small exceptions to make the site user-friendly*

See also information about data quality (Afghanistan used as example)
faq_general_a7_text:
Zeroes may denote issues with data quality (eg codes, dates, etc which are incompatible with the IATI Standard). There will shortly be links to the organisation’s page on the IATI dashboard to investigate specific data quality issues.

Dashes show that that donor/organisation is not currently an IATI Reporting Organisation.
faq_general_a8_text:
Newly published files are updated every night, as well as a full re-import of all files. The re-import ensures that any external value that may have been changed; for example, exchange rates, will be applied to all relevant data. Data is pulled from the IATI Registry.

CRS data is downloaded annually when it becomes available and then stored in Github.

faq_generator_a1_text: The Generator is a tool to help users to reproduce data from d-portal in other webpages/blogs.
faq_generator_a2_text: To help users who want to display their own data, or data they are interested in, within their own website/blog.
faq_generator_a3_text:
Make selections from the dropdown menus and C&P the code provided into your webpage’s html.

For more information see http://www.d-portal.org/news/2014-11-30-Interactive-IATI-data-d-portal-generator.html
faq_generator_a4_text: It’s dynamic, so will update automatically overnight. If you change your data, this will be reflected. So when you’ve got content from the generator in your site or blog post, it will change accordingly!
faq_generator_a5_text:
The embedded data in your blog post / website will stay up as long as the d-portal site is up (eg permanently).

The only time this can go wrong is if your website provider disallows you to include external widgets in your blog posts, ie. if you can embed a youtube video into your blog post, you can embed generator content in your post.
faq_generator_a6_text:
Both secured and non-secured HTTP access is enabled and supported on d-portal. This should let users on secured domains use Generator content.

Use https://d-portal.org/ctrack.html#view=generator instead.

If you are unsure if this affects you, see if your company's website uses https:// instead of http:// in the website address.
faq_generator_q4_text: How often will the generated content on my webpage update?
faq_generator_q6_text: Help! I'm trying to create the widget in my company's internal website but it's not working.
faq_paragraph1_text: d-portal is an expansive site that contains not only the country and organisation based portals but also tools like SAVi, Generator, Dash and Explore - a simple search interface backed by dstore and Q with filtering options to narrow search enquiries. With this comes a growing database of questions about the architecture and functionality of the different parts of the site.
faq_paragraph2_text: There are 4 sections - General, Technical, information about the Explore search feature and Generator widgets. We currently support both English and French translations. If you would like to provide translations for other languages, we encourage you to get in touch.
faq_technical_a11_text: These pages for individual activities come from IATI Registry.
faq_technical_a13_text:
Additional data is stored in Github, including
  • list of Reporting Organisation IDs
  • currencies
  • exchange rates
  • sector codes
  • CRS data
faq_technical_a14_text: Newly published files are updated every night, as well as a full re-import of all files. The re-import ensures that any external value that may have been changed; for example, exchange rates, will be applied to all relevant data.
faq_technical_a15_text: An activity which includes part of 2024 according to the activity’s start and end dates.
faq_technical_a16_text: Some organisations only produce data with 3 digit codes. We convert the 5 digit codes to 3 digits to unify the data for visualisation on d-portal.
faq_technical_a17_text: Google charts have deprecated these graphs - some country graphs are showing up as empty even when there is data in them. Bar charts allow users to see the data in relation to each other.
faq_technical_a18_text: We're only showing graphs that have been published using the same currency. We've kept SAVi (Simple Activity Viewer) as simple as possible so there are no extra calculations made on the page, just displaying the raw xml as we get them.
faq_technical_a19_text:
The transactions are merged if they are published for the same date.

The last transaction will stretch across the lifetime of the activity.
faq_technical_a1_text:
‘Expenditure’ and ‘Disbursements’ for Spend columns/data. If there are neither, but ‘Outgoing Commitment’ data exists, then the Outgoing Commitment data will be shown.

'Outgoing commitment' for Total commitment columns. If outgoing commitments have not been published, but Disbursement and Expenditure exist, then the sum of Disbursement and Expenditure will be shown.

‘Budgets’ in activity file, for Budget columns/data (eg in tables on d-portal) - if no budget data is present in the activity file, then ‘planned-disbursements’ are used if present.
faq_technical_a20_text: We display machine-readable data where possible (ie. when we have codelists for those elements), narratives within these elements will not be displayed.
faq_technical_a2_text:
• If a transaction date is not present, d-portal uses the transaction-value date in order to ascertain the date of a transaction (and therefore assign it to a specific year).
  • Only displaying countries that exist in ISO3166 Alpha-2.
  • Removing secondary organisations - flagged as secondary sources in IATI Registry - from tables (to avoid double counting, eg secondary organisations are for example UN-OCHA who re-publish data which would replicate data from those organisations in the same table - see here for list of secondary organisations excluded in these instances).
  • Not displaying organisations with 0 datasets in the IATI Registry.
  • If there are neither Expenditure nor Disbursement data but Commitment data does exist then the Commitment data will be displayed.
  • In order to match against CRS data in tables, government departments are combined and shown under the country name - details of which departments are in Github.
  • There are currently plans under consideration to use the lowest hierarchy level data only, should data at multiple hierarchies exist, in order to avoid double counting.
faq_technical_a3_text:
Using the transaction value date/transaction date (eg in Spend columns in tables).

Using the end date in the budget data (eg in Budget columns in tables).
faq_technical_a4_text:
Anything with invalid date ranges (eg start date after the end date).

Projects with invalid date ranges that cannot be placed in one of the other 3 categories (Active, Planned, Ended).
faq_technical_a5_text:
• Default USD

    Currently (please note this may change soon) converting to USD using the exchange rate of the date specified in the value-date attribute. So when we display USD, it is very accurate to that date.

  • Other currencies

    For other currencies, the USD value is just converted using today’s exchange rate (please note this may change soon).

  • For budget information in future?

    Using the latest exchange rates (International Monetary Fund) every night and doing a full re-import once a week, so future budgets will use the current exchange rates and should be updated weekly.
faq_technical_a6_text:
For charts - need a transaction with transaction date in the relevant year (the latest complete year, eg currently 2024) with a valid recipient country code or valid sector code, depending on which chart it is.

For tables - as above, with transaction date relating to the relevant year column in the table.

For maps - any transactions (from any year) with valid location tag and recipient country code (to be valid it needs to be on the relevant IATI codelists).
faq_technical_a8_text:
Activity start/end dates are used to work out which projects are active or ended or planned for the future.
  • Active projects are projects with a start date in the past and with an end date in the future.
  • Ended projects are projects with an end date in the past.
  • Planned projects are anything with a start date in the future.
faq_technical_a9_text: Using ‘location’ tags within the data to plot projects on the maps - either lat/long or point/pos, depending on which the organisation uses.
faq_technical_q10_text: How are US government organisations shown?
faq_technical_q11_text: Where does the data for Single Activity Viewer (SAVi) come from?

faq_technical_q16_text: Why are sector aggregations using three-digit codes when five-digit codes are published?
faq_technical_q17_text: For the country and sector graphs on the acitivity pages, why have your changed them into bars?
faq_technical_q18_text: Why are some graphs missing for some types of transactions on the acitivity pages?
faq_technical_q19_text: Why are there less nodules on some of the graphs for transactions on the activity pages?

faq_technical_q20_text: Why are some data not showing up on the activity pages when they are available in the XML?

feedback_paragraph1_text: Hello all and thank you for taking part as beta testers for d-portal.org. We welcome any and all feedback, suggestions and concerns you may have about the website so please feel free to post them as comments below. Overall, we want to focus on legibility and user experience, especially in terms of understanding the data that is being presented.
feedback_paragraph2_text: Thank you very much for taking the time to do this! We hope to create something useful and easily deployable, an interesting talking point but most importantly, promote use by those who need the information, and better data quality from reporting organisations.
footer10_text: If you have any queries about how the data is shown in d-portal, or how up to date the data is, please see the FAQ or contact the IATI support helpdesk
footer1_text: A project by the d-portal team
footer21_text: If you have any queries relating to the data itself, which is owned by the organisation,
footer8_text: It provides a search function and information by country or by organisation on development activities and budgets published to the International Aid Transparency Initiative (IATI).
footer9_text: d-portal is currently in BETA. While publicly available, d-portal is not considered finished. Please feedback if you experience any bugs and missing features.
gen_paragraph1_text: There is a huge amount of interesting information within IATI and significant value in being able to share bite-size pieces of it freely on other websites and blogs. The d-portal generator allows users to select specific information from d-portal and embed it directly into their own website code.
gen_paragraph2_text: Once you’ve embedded any content it will update automatically (overnight) as organisations’ data is updated in the IATI registry. When users click on the content they will be directed to the relevant page on d-portal so they can investigate further.
gen_paragraph3_text: The generator is currently accessible at http://www.d-portal.org/ctrack.html?#view=generator
github_info2_text: d-portal.org is open source. It is currently being developed and designed so things are constantly changing. Do send us your suggestions, code contributions, bug reports, fixes and issues or contact support@iatistandard.org
github_info3_text: If you would like to keep up to date with news on d-portal please subscribe to the Google group.

index_paragraph1_text: helps you explore IATI data by providing a search function and information by country or by organisation on development activities and budgets published to the International Aid Transparency Initiative (IATI). It is aimed at providing line ministries, parliamentarians and civil society in developing countries with information that can assist with the planning and monitoring of development activities.
index_paragraph2_text: d-portal contains current data published through the International Aid Transparency Initiative (IATI) as well as the most recent year's data available in the OECD DAC Creditor Reporting System.
index_paragraph3_text: Data in the dropdown menu is built from the database which updates everyday at GMT +0 with new data fetched from the IATI Registry.
index_paragraph4_text: We list countries that are reported by organisations using ISO3166 Alpha-2. For attribution and links to data sources, go here.
index_paragraph5_text: The list of organisations with their IATI identifier comes straight from the IATI Registry database.
index_paragraph6_text: The dropdown list of organisations comes from published XML activities reported by these organisations.
install_paragraph1_text: At the heart of the d-portal project is the aim that anyone anywhere could take the open source code behind d-portal, deploy it for themselves and create a customised d-portal for any country that interests them.  This could include adding any other data from Aid Information Management Systems, national budgets and a range of comparable socio-economic indicators.
install_paragraph2_text: There are already examples of customised country-specific d-portals like
install_paragraph3_text: d-portal is made up of the dstore backend and ctrack interface. To install d-portal, you need to set up a server.
install_paragraph4_text: How to install a d-portal server
install_paragraph5_text: By using iframes, the d-portal Generator allows you to embed sections of d-portal in any html-enabled publishing platform; ie. Wordpress blog post, Tumblr post, a website etc.
install_paragraph6_text: Visit http://d-portal.org/ctrack.html#view=generator to generate your chosen d-portal content.
install_title2_text: How to generate and re-use d-portal content

<form action="">
<select id="tongue_select" name="tongue">
	{tongue_select_options:tongue_select_option}
</select>

<script>
	$(function(){
		$('#tongue_select').children().each(function(i,it){
			if("{tongue}"==$(it).val())
			{
				$(it).attr("selected",1)
			}
		});
		$('#tongue_select').bind('change', function ()
		{
			var t="{_root}"+$(this).val()+"/";if(t=="{_root}eng/"){t="{_root}";}
			var url = t+"{_output_filename}";
			window.location = url; // redirect
			return false;
		});
	});
</script>

cmn.about_paragraph10_text: DI被开发和准备的现阶段资金至2014年八月底如果您有兴趣的d门户网站的持续发展的资金部分，请联系的support@iatistandard.org
cmn.about_paragraph11_text: 开源的概念依赖于其他人会加入，共同搭建更好的平台，希望能实现资源共享。这包括寻找和报告错误，贡献新的功能，你想要的平台，让他们甚至创造新的主题，以便其他人可以使用它。
cmn.about_paragraph12_text: 基于d-portal其他站点将在下面列出。 在我们向support@iatistandard.org你补充。
cmn.about_paragraph14_text: 1。哪里的资源来自哪里？ 2。他们在哪里去（按部门和位置)？
cmn.about_paragraph15_text: 最近，当前和未来的数据呈现和跨数据源相比较。
cmn.about_paragraph1_text: d-portal.org帮助您通过提供国家或通过发布到IATI开发活动和预算出版商信息探索IATI数据。
cmn.about_paragraph2_text: 它的目的是提供部委，国会议员和民间社会提供信息，可以帮助规划和监督发展活动。
cmn.about_paragraph3_text: 在其第一次迭代它包含通过国际援助透明度倡议（IATI），以及由的 OECD DAC Creditor Reporting System。
cmn.about_paragraph4_text: 当前平台提出了两个问题：哪里的资源从哪里来，到哪去了（按部门和地点）？近期，当前和未来的数据呈现和跨数据源进行比较。
cmn.about_paragraph5_text: 为了从一个国家的角度回答这些问题，这是不够的仅仅是为了显示可用的数据：
cmn.about_paragraph6_text: 是一个开源的平台。这意味着您可以使用该平台的所有方面建立使用免费的源代码，自己的门户。
cmn.about_paragraph7_text: 虽然它目前提供了一个通用的部署对于任何国家，它已经开发出了被定制在国内，以满足当地需求的具体意图。有关如何可以针对某一特定国家创建一个自定义版本的更多信息，请参阅如何安装。
cmn.about_paragraph9_text: d-portal.org从2013年12月跑到全球伙伴关系会议在墨西哥2014年4月的最初的发展是由 IATI 和 Development Initiatives (DI)。
cmn.alert1_text: d-portal.org还处于非常早期的开发，定于四月中旬Alpha版本。感谢您的耐心等待！很抱歉任何反馈
cmn.dash_paragraph1_text: 破折号是填充的d-portal.org，重点主要放在出版者统计和它们所报道的数据的质量的数据的概要。
cmn.dash_paragraph2_text: 通过展示你在何时何地无效数据报告，Dash就能解释，都反映在主站点上的差距。
cmn.dash_paragraph3_text: Dash是不是特定国家的，因此您将能看到所有的在所有国家提供的发行统计数据包含在门户。这是为了容纳一个事实，即有多个发布，在多个受援国报告活动。
cmn.dash_paragraph4_text: Dash是目前在访问http://d-portal.org/ctrack.html?#view=dash。 Dash是一项新功能，并仍处于开发阶段。
cmn.discover_paragraph1_text: Explore是一种新功能，目前正在开发状态。通过dstore支持和Q，它将为用户提供通过庞大的数据库IATI筛选一个简单的搜索界面。
cmn.discover_paragraph2_text: 目前，我们正在寻找关于<搜索>的直观性和可用性反馈。确实有一展身手，并通过 Github上论坛添加一个新的问题向我们发送反馈，或者，如果你愿意，通过 support@iatistandard.org取得联系。我们很想听听你的想法！
cmn.dlogs_paragraph1_text: 从夜间进口产生的d-portal数据库的统计图表。 这是为了跟踪越来越多的发布到d门户的IATI活动。
cmn.dquery_paragraph1_text: dquery是整个数据库的只读SQL接口，它为技术用户提供了访问所有IATI数据填充d-port的权限，并提供了下载XML，JSON，HTML和CSV格式的数据的选项。
cmn.dquery_paragraph2_text: 此新功能仍在测试和更新中。 如有任何疑问或建议，请与我们联系。
cmn.dquery_paragraph3_text: 使用 http://www.d-portal.org/dquery 上的界面
cmn.dstore_paragraph_text: dstore补贴的IATI数据存储与实时查询优化的nodeJS + PostgreSQL + SQLite的版本使用。
cmn.explore_paragraph1_text: 选择一个国家或低于出版商发掘他们的数据。
cmn.explore_paragraph2_text: 只有国家和出版商公布的数据，以IATI可供探索。
cmn.faq_explore_a1_text:
EXPLORE is made up of two parts – a series of filters, and a freetext box.

1. Filters

These are a selection of filters relating to the IATI Standard allowing users to choose and refine the IATI data they want to explore.

2. Freetext

This is a freetext box allowing users to search for themes and topics, and specific activities published to IATI.
cmn.faq_explore_a2_text: The EXPLORE feature is on the front page of d-portal.org and helps users find activities published to the IATI Standard based on keywords - it was originally developed to help people who wanted to find information on specific humanitarian crises.
cmn.faq_explore_a3_text:
Select multiple filters from across the dropdowns. As you build a query using these filters the space underneath the filters will populate with an indication of how many activities are available to view based on your selections.

You can then click ‘Explore Results’ to find out more about those activities.
cmn.faq_explore_a4_text:
Recipient Country and Publisher

The organisations that have published to the IATI Standard, and the countries where funds have gone to as published within IATI data.

Sector Group and Sector

The numeric codes and names to describe sectors within the OECD DAC CRS, as used within the IATI Standard.

Activity Status

The numeric codes and names within the IATI activity status field.

Year Range

Years from 1960 to ‘present year + 2’.

More filters

The numeric codes and names within the IATI activity status field. Click on Glossary to find out more about individual filters.
cmn.faq_explore_a5_text:
Type in one or more keywords and press enter to see how many activities have been found.

Click ‘Explore Results’ to see lists, graphs and maps allowing further exploration of the data.

Refine your search by adding multiple words – e.g. ‘Hurricane Matthew’ will find more refined (fewer) results than ‘Hurricane’.
cmn.faq_explore_a6_text: Clicking ‘Explore Results’ provides results in the usual d-portal format (stats and charts which you can explore by clicking through to tables).
cmn.faq_explore_a7_text: This searches the Title and Description fields within all published IATI activities.
cmn.faq_explore_a8_text: EXPLORE is adapted for English plural nouns - e.g. typing ‘Refugee’ will include results for ‘Refugees’.
cmn.faq_explore_a9_text: The COVID-19 button follows the IATI Publishing Guidance. It currently searches the database for COVID-19 in title and description fields and looks for the relevant codes in the humanitarian-scope element.

cmn.faq_general_a11_text: See milestones on GitHub issues page or contact us at support@iatistandard.org
cmn.faq_general_a12_text:
See the About page.

Look at the issues on GitHub.

Contact us - support@iatistandard.org
cmn.faq_general_a13_text:
Data that is marked as invalid IATI xml when using the Validator.

Mismatch between ‘Identifier’ in publisher’s profile in the IATI Registry, and reporting-org in that publisher’s data – this will show zeroes in the publisher’s data until the two are matched.

Transaction type code not present.

Not using either Disbursements or Expenditure in transaction type field.

Country and Sector graphs are displayed by adding up Transaction type codes 3 (Disbursement) and 4 (Expenditure) so activities without transactions or the right transaction type codes will not have these graphs.

Dates in incorrect format in the data.

Activities without end date are not shown on the list of projects ending soon or any lists that need an end date to order them.

The map section will not be shown if there are no activities with longitude and latitude data.

Illogical dates such as activity end date before activity start date.

No data relevant to the year being viewed on a pie chart or table (eg where a pie chart shows 2024 data and data published only relates to 2023).

If updating your Registry profile only, changes will show after the weekly full import (each weekend) as d-portal only updates nightly the data that has been changed in the xml.
cmn.faq_general_a1_text: A view of all IATI (International Aid Transparency Initiative) data by recipient country or publisher, comparable with latest OECD DAC CRS (Creditor Reporting System) data.
cmn.faq_general_a2_text: IATI and CRS data (see below for more information).
cmn.faq_general_a3_text: The International Aid Transparency Initiative - IATI is a voluntary, multi-stakeholder initiative that seeks to improve the transparency of aid, development, and humanitarian resources in order to increase their effectiveness in tackling poverty.
cmn.faq_general_a4_text: The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development’s Development Assistance Committee Creditor Reporting System - which contains Official Development Assistance data.
cmn.faq_general_a5_text:
The IATI data comes from the IATI Registry.

The CRS data comes from CRS tables and stored on Github.
cmn.faq_general_a6_text:
Publishers report their IATI data at varying degrees of detail, and data is updated and improved all the time by publishers. If a publisher only publishes data for 2023, it won’t appear in 2024 columns/charts etc.

d-portal attempts to only reflect what is in the data and does not make corrections to data or information published to IATI, with only small exceptions to make the site user-friendly*

See also information about data quality (Afghanistan used as example)
cmn.faq_general_a7_text:
Zeroes may denote issues with data quality (eg codes, dates, etc which are incompatible with the IATI Standard). There will shortly be links to the publisher’s page on the IATI dashboard to investigate specific data quality issues.

Dashes show that that donor/organisation is not currently an IATI publisher.
cmn.faq_general_a8_text:
IATI data is updated every night (importing any data which has changed from the previous day) and a full import is done each weekend - in each instance the data is pulled from the IATI Registry.

CRS data is downloaded annually when it becomes available and then stored in Github.

cmn.faq_generator_a1_text: The Generator is a tool to help users to reproduce data from d-portal in other webpages/blogs.
cmn.faq_generator_a2_text: To help users who want to display their own data, or data they are interested in, within their own website/blog.
cmn.faq_generator_a3_text:
Make selections from the dropdown menus and C&P the code provided into your webpage’s html.

For more information see http://www.d-portal.org/news/2014-11-30-Interactive-IATI-data-d-portal-generator.html
cmn.faq_generator_a4_text: It’s dynamic, so will update automatically overnight. If you change your data, this will be reflected. So when you’ve got content from the generator in your site or blog post, it will change accordingly!
cmn.faq_generator_a5_text:
The embedded data in your blog post / website will stay up as long as the d-portal site is up (eg permanently).

The only time this can go wrong is if your website provider disallows you to include external widgets in your blog posts, ie. if you can embed a youtube video into your blog post, you can embed generator content in your post.
cmn.faq_generator_a6_text:
Both secured and non-secured HTTP access is enabled and supported on d-portal. This should let users on secured domains use Generator content.

Use https://d-portal.org/ctrack.html#view=generator instead.

If you are unsure if this affects you, see if your company's website uses https:// instead of http:// in the website address.
cmn.faq_generator_q4_text: How often will the generated content on my webpage update?
cmn.faq_generator_q6_text: Help! I'm trying to create the widget in my company's internal website but it's not working.
cmn.faq_paragraph1_text: d-portal是不仅包含国家和出版商基于门户网站也有像赛维，发电机，短跑很快，搜索工具一个广阔的网站 - 由dstore和Q有了这个支持简单的搜索界面来约问题越来越数据库网站的不同部分的结构和功能。
cmn.faq_paragraph2_text: 现在，我们打破这些下降到3种不同类型的问题 - 通用，技术和有关发电机的问题。今后，我们将增加更多的选项卡列表中，以弥补即将到来的功能。我们目前支持英文和法文翻译。 如果您想提供其他语言的翻译，我们鼓励您联系。
cmn.faq_paragraph3_text: FAQ可以在 http://www.d-portal.org/faq.html被发现。
cmn.faq_technical_a11_text: These pages for individual activities come from IATI Registry..
cmn.faq_technical_a13_text:
Additional data is stored in Github, including
  • list of funder Org IDs
  • currencies
  • exchange rates
  • sector codes
  • CRS data
cmn.faq_technical_a14_text: Newly published files are updated every night, as well as a full re-import of all files. The re-import ensures that any external value that may have been changed; for example, exchange rates, will be applied to all relevant data.
cmn.faq_technical_a15_text: An activity which includes part of 2024 according to the activity’s start and end dates.
cmn.faq_technical_a16_text: Some publishers only produce data with 3 digit codes. We convert the 5 digit codes to 3 digits to unify the data for visualisation on d-portal.
cmn.faq_technical_a17_text: Google charts have deprecated these graphs - some country graphs are showing up as empty even when there is data in them. Bar charts allow users to see the data in relation to each other.
cmn.faq_technical_a18_text: We're only showing graphs that have been published using the same currency. We've kept SAVi (Simple Activity Viewer) as simple as possible so there are no extra calculations made on the page, just displaying the raw xml as we get them.
cmn.faq_technical_a19_text:
The transactions are merged if they are published for the same date.

The last transaction will stretch across the lifetime of the activity.
cmn.faq_technical_a1_text:
‘Expenditure’ and ‘Disbursements’ for Spend columns/data. If there are neither, but ‘Outgoing Commitment’ data exists, then the Outgoing Commitment data will be shown.

'Outgoing commitment' for Total commitment columns. If outgoing commitments have not been published, but Disbursement and Expenditure exist, then the sum of Disbursement and Expenditure will be shown.

‘Budgets’ in activity file, for Budget columns/data (eg in tables on d-portal) - if no budget data is present in the activity file, then ‘planned-disbursements’ are used if present.
cmn.faq_technical_a20_text: We display machine-readable data where possible (ie. when we have codelists for those elements), narratives within these elements will not be displayed.
cmn.faq_technical_a2_text:
• If a transaction date is not present, d-portal uses the transaction-value date in order to ascertain the date of a transaction (and therefore assign it to a specific year).
  • Only displaying countries that exist in ISO3166 Alpha-2.
  • Removing secondary publishers - flagged as secondary sources in IATI Registry - from tables (to avoid double counting, eg secondary publishers are for example UN-OCHA who re-publish data which would replicate data from those publishers in the same table - see here for list of secondary publishers excluded in these instances).
  • Not displaying publishers with 0 datasets in the IATI Registry.
  • If there are neither Expenditure nor Disbursement data but Commitment data does exist then the Commitment data will be displayed.
  • In order to match against CRS data in tables, government departments are combined and shown under the country name - details of which departments are in Github.
  • There are currently plans under consideration to use the lowest hierarchy level data only, should data at multiple hierarchies exist, in order to avoid double counting.
cmn.faq_technical_a3_text:
Using the transaction value date/transaction date (eg in Spend columns in tables).

Using the end date in the budget data (eg in Budget columns in tables).
cmn.faq_technical_a4_text:
Anything with invalid date ranges (eg start date after the end date).

Projects with invalid date ranges that cannot be placed in one of the other 3 categories (Active, Planned, Ended).
cmn.faq_technical_a5_text:
• Default USD

    Currently (please note this may change soon) converting to USD using the exchange rate of the date specified in the value-date attribute. So when we display USD, it is very accurate to that date.

  • Other currencies

    For other currencies, the USD value is just converted using today’s exchange rate (please note this may change soon).

  • For budget information in future?

    Using the latest exchange rates (International Monetary Fund) every night and doing a full re-import once a week, so future budgets will use the current exchange rates and should be updated weekly.
cmn.faq_technical_a6_text:
For charts - need a transaction with transaction date in the relevant year (the latest complete year, eg currently 2024) with a valid recipient country code or valid sector code, depending on which chart it is.

For tables - as above, with transaction date relating to the relevant year column in the table.

For maps - any transactions (from any year) with valid location tag and recipient country code (to be valid it needs to be on the relevant IATI codelists).
cmn.faq_technical_a8_text:
Activity start/end dates are used to work out which projects are active or ended or planned for the future.
  • Active projects are projects with a start date in the past and with an end date in the future.
  • Ended projects are projects with an end date in the past.
  • Planned projects are anything with a start date in the future.
cmn.faq_technical_a9_text: Using ‘location’ tags within the data to plot projects on the maps - either lat/long or point/pos, depending on which the publisher uses.

cmn.feedback_paragraph1_text: 您好，感谢大家参加beta测试者的手为d-portal.org。我们欢迎任何及所有反馈意见，建议和关注，你可能对网站的，所以请随意张贴'时间如下意见。整体而言，我们希望把重点放在易读性和用户体验，特别是在理解正在被提出的数据条款。
cmn.feedback_paragraph2_text: 非常感谢您抽出宝贵的时间来做到这一点！我们希望创造一些有用的东西，轻松地部署，一个有趣的谈论的焦点瞄准最重要的是促进从报告发布机构更高质量的数据。
cmn.footer10_text: 如果您对数据在d-portal中的显示方式有任何疑问，或者如何了解最新数据，请参阅常见问题或联系IATI支持服务台
cmn.footer15_text: Generator - 小工具为您的网站
cmn.footer21_text: 如果您有任何关于数据本身的问题（由发布者拥有）
cmn.footer5_text: 许可：麻省理工学院许可证(MIT)于2014年
cmn.footer8_text: 它提供了按国家或通过发布到IATI开发活动和预算出版商信息。
cmn.footer9_text: 我们目前正处于测试阶段。而d-portal是公开的，它不被视为成品。您可能会遇到错误和缺失的功能，但是这就是为什么我们需要您的反馈和支持。
cmn.gen_paragraph1_text: 有一个巨大的内IATI有趣的信息，并能够分享自由地在其他网站和博客一口大小的块就显著的价值数额。在d-portal发生器允许用户选择从d-portal网站的具体信息，并直接嵌入到自己的网站代码。

faq.html.html:
<html>
<head>
	<meta charset="UTF-8">
	<title>Frequently Asked Questions: d-portal</title>
	<script src="{_root}jslib/jquery.js"></script>
	<script>
			$(function(){
				$('a.topics.a').addClass("on");
				$('a.faq_top').hide();
				$('.faq_wrap.tech').hide();
				$('.faq_wrap.explore').hide();
				$('.faq_wrap.gene').hide();
				
				$('a.topics.a').click(function () {
					$('.faq_wrap.gen').show();
					$('.faq_wrap.tech').hide();
					$('.faq_wrap.explore').hide();
					$('.faq_wrap.gene').hide();
					$('a.topics.a').addClass("on");
					$('a.topics.b').removeClass("on");
					$('a.topics.d').removeClass("on");
					$('a.topics.c').removeClass("on");
				});
				$('a.topics.b').click(function () {
					$('.faq_wrap.gen').hide();
					$('.faq_wrap.tech').show();
					$('.faq_wrap.explore').hide();
					$('.faq_wrap.gene').hide();
					$('a.topics.a').removeClass("on");
					$('a.topics.b').addClass("on");
					$('a.topics.d').removeClass("on");
					$('a.topics.c').removeClass("on");
				});
				$('a.topics.d').click(function () {
					$('.faq_wrap.gen').hide();
					$('.faq_wrap.tech').hide();
					$('.faq_wrap.explore').show();
					$('.faq_wrap.gene').hide();
					$('a.topics.a').removeClass("on");
					$('a.topics.b').removeClass("on");
					$('a.topics.d').addClass("on");
					$('a.topics.c').removeClass("on");
				});
				$('a.topics.c').click(function () {
					$('.faq_wrap.gen').hide();
					$('.faq_wrap.tech').hide();
					$('.faq_wrap.explore').hide();
					$('.faq_wrap.gene').show();
					$('a.topics.a').removeClass("on");
					$('a.topics.b').removeClass("on");
					$('a.topics.d').removeClass("on");
					$('a.topics.c').addClass("on");
				});
				
				$('.faq_links_wrap a').click(function () {
					console.log($(this).attr('href'));
					$('span.list').parent().removeClass("on");
					$($(this).attr('href')).parent().addClass("on");
				});
				
				$(document).scroll(function() {
					var y = $(this).scrollTop();
					if (y > 800) {
						$('a.faq_top').show().css('left',$('.default').offset().left+960);
					} else {
						$('a.faq_top').hide();
					}
				});
				
				// Switch to tab depending upon hash at page load
				var hash=window.location.hash;
				switch(hash.substring(0,5))
				{
					case "#tech":
						$('a.topics.b').click()
						$('html,body').animate({scrollTop: $(hash).offset().top},'slow');
					break;
					case "#expl":
						$('a.topics.d').click()
						$('html,body').animate({scrollTop: $(hash).offset().top},'slow');
					break;
					case "#gene":
						$('a.topics.c').click()
						$('html,body').animate({scrollTop: $(hash).offset().top},'slow');
					break;
				}

			});
		</script>
	<style>{css}</style>
	{ganal}
</head>
<body>
	{view_head}
	{main_head}
	{faq}
	{view_tail}
</body>
</html>

fra.about_paragraph10_text: DI finance le stade actuel de développement et de préparation à la fin de Août 2014, si vous êtes intéressé par une partie du financement de l'élaboration en cours de d- portail s'il vous plaît contacter support@iatistandard.org
fra.about_paragraph11_text: Le concept open source repose sur le partage des ressources dans l'espoir que d'autres se joindront et construire une meilleure plate-forme ensemble. Cela comprend la recherche et signaler les bogues, contribuant de nouvelles fonctionnalités que vous souhaitez la plate-forme d'avoir ou même de créer de nouveaux thèmes afin que les autres puissent l'utiliser.
fra.about_paragraph12_text: Autres sites basés sur d-portal seront listés ci-dessous. Contactez-nous au support@iatistandard.org d'ajouter le vôtre ici.
fra.about_paragraph14_text: 1. D'où proviennent les ressources? 2. Où vont-ils (par secteur et localisation)?
fra.about_paragraph15_text: Des données récentes, actuelles et futures est présenté et comparé les sources de données.
fra.about_paragraph1_text: d-portal.org vous aide à explorer les données IATI en fournissant des informations par pays ou par l'éditeur sur les activités de développement et les budgets publiés à IATI.
fra.about_paragraph2_text: Il vise à fournir des ministères de tutelle , les parlementaires et la société civile des informations qui peuvent aider à la planification et au suivi des activités de développement.
fra.about_paragraph3_text: Dans sa première itération , il contient des données actuelles publiées par l'Initiative internationale pour la transparence de l'aide ( IATI ), ainsi que les plus récentes (2012) données publiées par la créanciers du CAD de l'OCDE système de notification.
fra.about_paragraph4_text: La plate-forme actuelle pose deux questions : d'où viennent les ressources proviennent , et où vont-ils ( par secteur et localisation) ? Des données récentes , en cours et à venir est présenté et comparé différentes sources de données.
fra.about_paragraph5_text: Afin de répondre à ces questions dans une perspective de pays, il ne suffit pas simplement d'afficher des données disponibles :
fra.about_paragraph6_text: est une plate-forme open source. Cela signifie que vous pouvez utiliser tous les aspects de la plate-forme pour construire votre propre portail en utilisant le code source libre.
fra.about_paragraph7_text: Bien qu'il fournit actuellement un déploiement générique pour n'importe quel pays, il a été développé avec l'intention spécifique d'être personnalisée dans le pays pour répondre aux besoins locaux. Pour plus d'informations sur la façon dont vous pouvez créer une version personnalisée pour un pays spécifique, voir Comment installer.
fra.about_paragraph9_text: Le développement initial de d - portal.org qui a duré à partir de décembre 2013 pour la réunion du Partenariat mondial au Mexique en Avril 2014 a été financée par IATI et Development Initiatives (DI).
fra.alert1_text: d-portal.org est encore en développement très tôt, prévue pour Alpha presse mi-Avril. Merci pour votre patience! S'il vous plaît fournir une rétroaction
fra.dash_paragraph1_text: Dash est un aperçu des données qui peuplent d-portal.org avec un accent principalement sur ​​les statistiques de l'éditeur et la qualité des données déclarées par eux.
fra.dash_paragraph2_text: En vous montrant où et quand des données non valides est rapporté, Dash sera en mesure d'expliquer les écarts qui se reflètent sur ​​le site principal.
fra.dash_paragraph3_text: Dash n'est pas pays spécifique de sorte que vous pourrez voir toutes les statistiques des éditeurs disponibles dans tous les pays inclus dans le portail. C'est à accueillir le fait qu'il existe plusieurs éditeurs qui signalent des activités dans plusieurs pays bénéficiaires.
fra.dash_paragraph4_text: Dash est actuellement accessible à l'adresse http://d-portal.org/ctrack.html?#view=dash. Dash est une nouvelle fonctionnalité et est encore en cours d'élaboration.
fra.discover_paragraph1_text: Explore est une nouvelle fonctionnalité qui est actuellement en cours de développement. Soutenu par dStore et Q, il fournira une interface de recherche simple pour les utilisateurs de filtrer à travers la vaste base de données de IATI.
fra.discover_paragraph2_text: Nous recherchons actuellement des commentaires sur le intuitivité et la convivialité de Explore. N'avoir un aller et envoyez-nous vos commentaires en ajoutant une nouvelle émission à travers le Github forum ou, si vous préférez, entrer en contact par le biais support@iatistandard.org. Nous aimerions entendre ce que vous pensez!
fra.dlogs_paragraph1_text: Statistiques et graphiques de la base de données d-portal générés à partir des importations nocturnes. Cela a été créé pour suivre le nombre croissant d'activités de l'IATI publiées dans d-portal.
fra.dlogs_paragraph2_text: Visitez la base de données à https://xriss.github.io/D-Portal-Logs/
fra.dquery_paragraph1_text: Interface SQL en lecture seule vers la base de données complète, dquery fournit aux utilisateurs techniques un accès à toutes les données IATI qui peuplent d-portal et des options pour télécharger les données aux formats XML, JSON, HTML et CSV.
fra.dquery_paragraph2_text: Cette nouvelle fonctionnalité est toujours en cours de test et de mise à jour. Veuillez nous contacter si vous avez des questions ou des suggestions.
fra.dstore_paragraph_text: dstore subventionne l' IATI Registry avec une version nodejs + PostgreSQL + SQLite optimisé pour une utilisation dans les requêtes en temps réel.
fra.explore_paragraph1_text: Choisissez un pays ou de l'éditeur ci-dessous pour explorer leurs données.
fra.explore_paragraph2_text: Seuls les pays et les éditeurs avec les données publiées à IATI sont disponibles pour l'exploration.
fra.faq_explore_a1_text:
EXPLORE est composé de deux parties, soit d’une série de filtres et d’une boîte de texte libre.

1. Les filtres

Il s’agit d’une série de filtres ayant trait à la norme de l’IITA permettant aux utilisateurs de choisir et de préciser les données de l’IITA qu’ils souhaitent explorer.

2. Texte libre

Il s’agit d’une boîte de texte libre permettant aux utilisateurs de rechercher des thèmes, des sujets et des activités précises publiées dans le cadre de l’IITA.
fra.faq_explore_a2_text: La fonction EXPLORE se trouve à la page d’accueil du d-portal.org et aide les utilisateurs à trouver des activités publiées selon la norme de l’IITA au moyen de mots-clés. À l’origine, EXPLORE était conçu pour aider les personnes à trouver des renseignements sur des crises humanitaires précises.
fra.faq_explore_a3_text:
On peut sélectionner plusieurs filtres parmi les listes déroulantes. À mesure que vous créerez votre requête en utilisant les filtres, le nombre d’activités consultables s’affichera sous les filtres selon vos choix.

Vous pourrez ensuite cliquer sur « Explore Results » (explorer les résultats) afin d’en savoir davantage sur ces activités.
fra.faq_explore_a4_text:
Pays bénéficiaires et organisations déclarantes

Il s’agit des organismes qui ont publié selon la norme de l’IITA, ainsi que les pays qui ont reçu des fonds, tels que publiés dans les données de l’IITA.

Groupe sectoriel et secteur

Il s’agit des codes numériques et des noms servant à décrire les secteurs au sein du SNPC du CAD de l’OCDE, utilisés dans le cadre de la norme de l’IITA.

Statut de l’activité

Il s’agit des codes numériques et des noms dans le champ relatif au statut de l’activité de l’IITA.

Périodes

De 1960 à aujourd’hui + 2.

More filters

The numeric codes and names within the IATI activity status field. Click on Glossary to find out more about individual filters.
fra.faq_explore_a5_text:
Il suffit d’écrire un ou plusieurs mots-clés et d’appuyer sur « Entrée » afin de voir combien d’activités ont été trouvées.

Cliquez sur « Explore Results » (explorer les résultats) pour voir des listes, des graphiques et des cartes permettant un examen approfondi des données.

Affinez votre recherche en ajoutant plusieurs mots. Par exemple, « Ouragan Matthew » générera plus de résultats précis (mais moins en nombre) que seulement « Ouragan ».
fra.faq_explore_a6_text: En cliquant sur « Explore Results » (explorer les résultats), les résultats apparaissent dans le format habituel du d-portal (sous forme de statistiques et de graphiques qu’il est possible d’explorer en cliquant dans les tableaux).
fra.faq_explore_a7_text: Les champs Titre et Description de toutes les activités publiées de l’IITA font l’objet de la recherche.
fra.faq_explore_a8_text: L’outil EXPLORE est adapté aux noms au pluriel en anglais. Par exemple, en écrivant « réfugié », « réfugiés » sera compris dans les résultats.
fra.faq_explore_a9_text: The COVID-19 button follows the IATI Publishing Guidance. It currently searches the database for COVID-19 in title and description fields and looks for the relevant codes in the humanitarian-scope element.

fra.faq_general_a13_text:
Données signalées comme xml de l’IITA invalide par le valideur.

Incohérence entre l’ « identifiant » dans le profil de l’organisation déclarante du Registre de l’IITA et le reporting-org dans ses données – des zéros apparaîtront dans ses données jusqu’à ce que les deux correspondent.

Absence du code du type de transaction.

Absence de décaissement ou dépense dans le type de transaction.

Country and Sector graphs are displayed by adding up Transaction type codes 3 (Disbursement) and 4 (Expenditure) so activities without transactions or the right transaction type codes will not have these graphs.

Dates saisies dans un format incorrect.

Dates incohérentes, comme la date de fin d’une activité qui précède sa date de début.

Aucune donnée correspondant à l’année visionnée dans un graphique circulaire ou un tableau (p. ex. : lorsqu’un graphique circulaire présente des données pour 2024, tandis que les données publiées ne concernent que 2023).

Une mise à jour du profil dans le Registre n’apparaîtra qu’après l’importation complète hebdomadaire (chaque fin de semaine), car le d-portal n’actualise chaque nuit que les données qui ont été modifiées dans le fichier XML.
fra.faq_general_a1_text: Il s’agit d’un outil donnant un aperçu de toutes les données de l’IITA (Initiative internationale pour la transparence de l’aide) par pays bénéficiaire ou organisation déclarante, comparable aux données récentes du SNPC (Système de notification des pays créanciers) du Comité d’aide au développement (CAD) de l’Organisation de coopération et de développement (OCDE).
fra.faq_general_a2_text: Les données de l’IITA et du SNPC (voir ci-dessous pour obtenir de plus amples renseignements).
fra.faq_general_a3_text: L’Initiative internationale pour la transparence de l’aide (IITA) est une initiative volontaire et pluri-partite qui vise à améliorer la transparence de l’aide, du développement et des ressources humanitaires afin d’accroître l’efficacité de la lutte contre la pauvreté.
fra.faq_general_a4_text: Il s’agit du Système de notification des pays créanciers du Comité d’aide au développement (CAD) de l’Organisation de coopération et de développement économiques (OCDE) qui contient des données sur l’aide publique au développement.
fra.faq_general_a5_text:
Les données de l’IITA sont tirées du Registre de l’IITA.

Les données du SNPC proviennent des tableaux du SNPC.

D’autres données sont consignées dans une feuille de calcul de Github.
fra.faq_general_a6_text:
Les organisations présentent leurs données de l’IITA selon différents niveaux de détails. Elles les mettent à jour et les améliorent constamment. Si une organisation ne publie des données que pour 2023, elles n’apparaîtront pas dans les colonnes ou les graphiques de 2024.

Le d-portal reflète simplement les données; aucune correction n’est apportée aux données ou aux informations publiées dans le cadre de l’IITA, sauf quelques exceptions pour rendre le site plus convivial.

Consultez aussi les informations sur la qualité des données (l’Afghanistan est utilisé à titre d’exemple)
fra.faq_general_a7_text:
Les zéros peuvent indiquer un problème relatif à la qualité des données (p. ex. : codes, dates, etc. incompatible avec la norme de l’IITA). Des liens vers le profil de l’organisation seront bientôt intégrés au tableau de bord de l’IITA afin d’examiner des problèmes de qualité des données précis.

Les tirets indiquent que le donateur ou l’organisme ne publie pas de données de l’IITA à l’heure actuelle.
fra.faq_general_a8_text:
Les données de l’IITA sont mises à jour chaque nuit (en important les données qui ont été modifiées le jour précédent) et une importation complète des données a lieu chaque fin de semaine. Dans chaque cas, les données sont tirées du Registre de l’IITA.

Les données du SNPC sont téléchargées annuellement et stockées dans de Github.
fra.faq_general_a9_text: Consultez le tableau de bord de l’IITA.

fra.faq_generator_a1_text: Le Generator (générateur) est un outil servant à aider les utilisateurs à reproduire les données du d-portal dans d’autres pages Web ou blogues.
fra.faq_generator_a2_text: Il a été créé afin d’aider les utilisateurs qui veulent afficher leurs propres données, ou les données qui les intéressent, dans leur propre site Web ou blogue.
fra.faq_generator_a3_text:
Il suffit de sélectionner des options dans les listes déroulantes et coller-copier le code fourni dans le HTML de la page Web.

Pour obtenir de plus amples renseignements, consultez la page http://www.d-portal.org/news/2014-11-30-Interactive-IATI-data-d-portal-generator.html
fra.faq_generator_a4_text: Il s’agit d’un outil dynamique, le contenu s’actualisera donc automatiquement pendant la nuit. Si vous modifiez vos données, les changements apportés seront reflétés. Ainsi, lorsque votre site ou billet de blogue contient des informations tirées de Generator, celles-ci changeront en conséquence.
fra.faq_generator_a5_text:
Les données intégrées dans votre site Web ou billet de blogue seront affichées aussi longtemps que le d-portal sera opérationnel (à savoir, de façon permanente).

Le seul problème qui pourrait survenir est que votre fournisseur de site Web refuse que vous incorporiez des widgets externes à vos billets de blogue, mais si vous pouvez intégrer une vidéo YouTube à votre blogue, vous pouvez intégrer du contenu de Generator dans votre billet.
fra.faq_generator_a6_text:
Les accès HTTP protégé et non protégé sont permis et soutenus par d-portal. Les utilisateurs travaillant à partir de domaines protégés devraient pouvoir utiliser le contenu du Generator.

Vous pouvez aussi utiliser https://d-portal.org/ctrack.html#view=generator.

Si vous n’êtes pas certain d’être visé, vérifiez si l’adresse du site Web de votre entreprise commence par https:// plutôt que http://.
fra.faq_generator_q4_text: À quelle fréquence le contenu généré dans ma page Web sera-t-il mis à jour?
fra.faq_generator_q5_text: Quel est le degré de fiabilité de cet outil?
fra.faq_generator_q6_text: À l’aide! J’essaie de créer le widget dans le site Web interne de mon entreprise, mais ça ne fonctionne pas.
fra.faq_paragraph1_text: d-portail est un site expansive qui contient des portails basés non seulement du pays et de l'éditeur, mais aussi des outils comme Savi, Générateur, Dash et bientôt, Recherche - une interface de recherche simple soutenue par dStore et Q. Avec cela vient d'une base de données de plus en plus de questions sur l'architecture et le fonctionnement des différentes parties du site.
fra.faq_paragraph2_text: Pour l'instant, nous brisons ces bas à 3 différents types de questions - général, technique et des questions sur le générateur. À l'avenir, nous allons ajouter plusieurs onglets à la liste pour compenser les fonctionnalités à venir. Nous supportons actuellement les traductions en anglais et en français. Si vous souhaitez fournir des traductions pour d'autres langues, nous vous encourageons à nous contacter.

Dans la feuille de calcul de Github. On y consigne :
  • la liste des identifiants des organismes de financement;
  • les devises;
  • les taux de change;
  • les codes de secteur;

fra.faq_technical_a14_text: Les fichiers récemment publiés sont mis à jour toutes les nuits. La réimportation permet de s’assurer que des valeurs externes ayant pu être modifiées, comme les taux de change, seront appliquées à toutes les données pertinentes.
fra.faq_technical_a15_text: Une activité qui a en partie eu lieu en 2024, conformément à ses dates de début et de fin.
fra.faq_technical_a16_text: Some publishers only produce data with 3 digit codes. We convert the 5 digit codes to 3 digits to unify the data for visualisation on d-portal.
fra.faq_technical_a17_text: Google charts have deprecated these graphs - some country graphs are showing up as empty even when there is data in them. Bar charts allow users to see the data in relation to each other.
fra.faq_technical_a18_text: We're only showing graphs that have been published using the same currency. We've kept SAVi (Simple Activity Viewer) as simple as possible so there are no extra calculations made on the page, just displaying the raw xml as we get them.
fra.faq_technical_a19_text:
The transactions are merged if they are published for the same date.

The last transaction will stretch across the lifetime of the activity.
fra.faq_technical_a1_text:
On utilise « Dépense » ou « Décaissement » pour les données ou les colonnes relatives aux dépenses. S’il ne s’agit pas d’une dépense ou d’un décaissement, mais qu’il existe des données sur les « engagements », ces dernières apparaîtront.

'Outgoing commitment' for Total commitment columns. If outgoing commitments have not been published, but Disbursement and Expenditure exist, then the sum of Disbursement and Expenditure will be shown.

On utilise « Budgets » du fichier Activités pour les données relatives au budget pour les données ou colonnes pertinentes (p.ex. : tableaux dans le d-portal). S’il n’y a aucune donnée budgétaire dans le fichier Activités, « décaissements prévus » sera utilisé s’il y en a.
fra.faq_technical_a2_text:
• Si la date d’une transaction n’est pas fournie, le d-portal utilise la date relative à la valeur de la transaction pour établir la date d’une transaction (et, par conséquent, lui assigner une année spécifique).
  • Seuls les pays codés selon ISO3166 Alpha-2 sont affichés.
  • Les éditeurs secondaires – signalés comme des sources secondaires dans le Registre de l’IITA – sont éliminés des tableaux afin d’éviter les répétitions (p. ex.le Bureau de coordination des affaires humanitaires [OCHA] des Nations Unies qui republie des données d’organisations déclarantes qui se trouvent dans les mêmes tableaux. Voici la liste des éditeurs secondaires exclus dans ces cas.)
  • Les organisations qui n’ont aucun ensemble de données dans le Registre de l’IITA ne sont pas affichées.
  • S’il n’existe aucune donnée relative aux dépenses ou aux décaissements, mais qu’il existe des données sur les engagements, ces dernières seront affichées.
  • Afin d’établir une correspondance avec les données du SNPC dans les tableaux, les ministères sont regroupés et présentés sous le nom du pays. Les détails relatifs aux ministères sont consignés dans ctrack.
  • On examine actuellement la possibilité de n’utiliser que les données du niveau hiérarchique le plus bas, s’il existe des données à différents niveaux de hiérarchie, afin d’éviter les répétitions.
fra.faq_technical_a3_text:
En utilisant la date relative à la valeur transactionnelle ou la date de la transaction (p. ex. : dans les colonnes des dépenses des tableaux).

En utilisant la date de fin des données budgétaires (p. ex. : dans les colonnes relatives au budget des tableaux).
fra.faq_technical_a4_text:
Tout ce qui est délimité dans le temps par des dates incohérentes (p. ex. : une date de début ultérieure à la date de fin).

Les projets dont l’échéancier comporte des dates incohérentes qui ne permettent pas de classer le projet dans l’une des trois catégories « en cours », « prévu » et « terminé ».
fra.faq_technical_a5_text:
• En dollars américains par défaut.

    Pour le moment (veuillez noter que cela pourrait bientôt changer), la conversion au dollar américain est fondée sur le taux de change à la date précisée dans l’attribut date-valeur. Par conséquent, lorsqu’un montant est affiché en dollar américain, celui-ci correspond très exactement à cette date.

  • Autres devises

    Pour ce qui est des autres devises, la valeur du dollar américain est simplement convertie en utilisant le taux de change du jour (veuillez noter que cela pourrait bientôt changer).

  • À titre d’information budgétaire pour le futur?

    On utilise les taux de change les plus récents (Fonds monétaire international) chaque nuit et procède à la réimportation complète une fois par semaine, de sorte à ce que les budgets pour l’avenir soient fondés sur les taux de change en cours et soient mis à jour hebdomadairement.
fra.faq_technical_a6_text:
Pour ce qui est des graphiques, il faut une transaction dont la date correspond à l’année appropriée (la dernière année complète, comme 2024 dans le cas présent) et ayant un code de pays bénéficiaire valide ou un code de secteur valide, selon le type de graphique.

Il en va de même pour les tableaux, il faut une date de transaction se rapportant à la colonne de l’année appropriée dans le tableau.

En ce qui a trait aux cartes, il faut que les transactions (peu importe l’année) aient une étiquette d’emplacement et un code de pays bénéficiaire valides (pour qu’ils soient valides, ils doivent apparaître dans les listes de codes appropriées de l’IITA).
fra.faq_technical_a7_text: Voici la page Wikipédia qui présente les codes ISO.
fra.faq_technical_a8_text:
Les dates de début et de fin d’une activité servent à déterminer les projets qui sont en cours, terminés ou prévus dans l’avenir.
  • Les projets en cours sont ceux dont la date de début se situe dans le passé et la date de fin dans le futur.
  • Les projets terminés sont ceux dont la date de fin se situe dans le passé.
  • Les projets prévus sont ceux dont la date de début se situe dans le futur.
fra.faq_technical_a9_text: On utilise des étiquettes d’emplacement dans les données afin de placer les projets sur les cartes, soit des données relatives à la latitude/longitude ou au point/positionnement, selon le choix de l’organisation déclarante.

fra.feedback_paragraph1_text: Bonjour, tous et vous remercier d'avoir pris part en tant que bêta-testeurs pour d-portal.org. Nous accueillons toutes et tous commentaires, suggestions et préoccupations que vous pourriez avoir sur le site donc s'il vous plaît n'hésitez pas à les poster dans les commentaires ci-dessous. Globalement, nous voulons nous concentrer sur la lisibilité et de l'expérience de l'utilisateur, notamment en termes de compréhension des données qui vous est présentée.
fra.feedback_paragraph2_text: Merci beaucoup d'avoir pris le temps de le faire! Nous espérons créer quelque chose d'utile et facile à déployer, un sujet de discussion intéressant, mais le plus important, de promouvoir une meilleure qualité de données d'organisations de rapports.

fra.footer9_text: Nous sommes actuellement en BETA. Alors que d-portail est accessible au public, il est pas considéré comme terminé. Vous pouvez rencontrer des bugs et fonctionnalités manquantes, mais qui est la raison pour laquelle nous avons besoin de vos commentaires et de soutien.

fra.index_paragraph1_text: est une plate-forme d'information sur le pays qui permet de suivre les flux de ressources. Elle vise à fournir des ministères de tutelle, les parlementaires et la société civile des informations qui peuvent aider à la planification et au suivi des activités de développement.
fra.index_paragraph2_text: Dans sa première itération, il contient des données actuelles publiées par l'Initiative internationale pour la transparence de l'aide (IATI), ainsi que les plus récentes (2012) des données agrégées publiées par le créancier CAD de l'OCDE Système de notification. Développement futur comprendra, entre autres, les données des information sur l'aide systèmes de gestion, les budgets nationaux et une série d'indicateurs socio- économiques comparables.
fra.index_paragraph3_text: Les données dans le menu déroulant est construit à partir de la base de données qui met à jour tous les jours GMT +0 avec de nouvelles données récupérées à partir du Registre de IATI.
fra.index_paragraph4_text: Nous listons les pays qui sont signalés par les éditeurs utilisant ISO3166 Alpha-2. Pour l'attribution et un lien vers les sources de données, aller ici.
fra.index_paragraph5_text: La liste des éditeurs avec leur IATI éditeur ID vient directement de la base de données du Registre de IATI.

fra.news_paragraph3_text: Les mises à jour sont peu fréquentes.
fra.news_paragraph4_text: Commencez à lire Nouvelles http://www.d-portal.org/news.html

hin.about_paragraph10_text: डि अगस्त 2014 के अंत तक विकास और तैयारी के वर्तमान चरण के वित्तपोषण है आप d-portal के चल रहे विकास के वित्त पोषण के हिस्से में रुचि रखते हैं,support@iatistandard.org
hin.about_paragraph11_text: खुला स्रोत अवधारणा को उम्मीद है कि दूसरों में शामिल होने और एक बेहतर मंच का निर्माण एक साथ होगा में संसाधनों के बंटवारे पर निर्भर करता है। यह निष्कर्ष और रिपोर्टिंग कीड़े, कि आपके पास करने के लिए मंच चाहें नई सुविधाओं योगदान दे या यहां तक ​​कि नए विषयों बनाने ताकि दूसरों को इसका इस्तेमाल कर सकते हैं।
hin.about_paragraph12_text: d-portal के आधार पर अन्य साइटों के नीचे सूचीबद्ध किया जाएगा। तुम्हारा जोड़ने के लिए यहाँ support@iatistandard.org पर हमसे संपर्क करें।
hin.about_paragraph14_text: 1।जहां संसाधनों? 2। जहां वे (क्षेत्र और स्थान के आधार पर) जाना है?
hin.about_paragraph15_text: हाल के वर्तमान और भविष्य के डेटा प्रस्तुत किया और डेटा स्रोतों भर में तुलना की जाती है।
hin.about_paragraph1_text: d-portal.org आप देश से या विकास गतिविधियों और बजट IATI को प्रकाशित पर प्रकाशक द्वारा जानकारी प्रदान करके IATI डेटा का पता लगाने में मदद करता है।
hin.about_paragraph2_text: यह योजना और विकास गतिविधियों की निगरानी के साथ सहायता कर सकते हैं कि जानकारी के साथ मंत्रालयों , सांसदों और सिविल सोसायटी को उपलब्ध कराने के उद्देश्य से है .
hin.about_paragraph3_text: इसकी पहली यात्रा में यह अंतरराष्ट्रीय सहायता पारदर्शिता पहल ( IATI ) के रूप में भी OECD DAC Creditor Reporting System.
hin.about_paragraph4_text: वर्तमान मंच दो सवाल बन गया है : जहां संसाधनों से आती हैं , और जहां वे ( क्षेत्र और स्थान के आधार पर ) जाते हो? , हाल के वर्तमान और भविष्य में डेटा प्रस्तुत किया है और डेटा स्रोतों के पार तुलना में है.
hin.about_paragraph5_text: एक देश के नजरिए से इन सवालों के जवाब देने के क्रम में यह महज उपलब्ध डेटा प्रदर्शित करने के लिए अपर्याप्त है :
hin.about_paragraph6_text: एक खुला स्रोत मंच है .  इसका मतलब है आप मुक्त स्रोत कोड का उपयोग कर अपने स्वयं के पोर्टल का निर्माण करने के लिए मंच के सभी पहलुओं का उपयोग कर सकते हैं।
hin.about_paragraph7_text: यह वर्तमान में किसी भी देश के लिए एक सामान्य तैनाती प्रदान करता है जबकि यह स्थानीय जरूरतों को पूरा करने में देश अनुकूलित किया जा रहा है की विशिष्ट इरादे से विकसित किया गया है. आप एक विशिष्ट देश के लिए एक अनुकूलित संस्करण बना सकते हैं पर अधिक जानकारी के लिए, कैसे स्थापित करें देखें.
hin.about_paragraph9_text: अप्रैल 2014 में मेक्सिको में वैश्विक भागीदारी बैठक दिसंबर 2013 से भाग गया जो d-portal.org के प्रारंभिक विकास द्वारा वित्त पोषित किया गया IATI और Development Initiatives (DI).
hin.alert1_text: d-portal.org अप्रैल के मध्य अल्फा रिलीज के लिए निर्धारित है, बहुत जल्दी विकास में अब भी है . अपने मरीज के लिए धन्यवाद! Ooops कोई प्रतिक्रिया
hin.country_dropmenu_text: एक प्राप्तकर्ता देश का चयन करें
hin.dash_paragraph1_text: Dash मुख्य रूप से प्रकाशक आँकड़ों पर ध्यान देने और उनके द्वारा रिपोर्ट डेटा की गुणवत्ता के साथ d-portal.org populating डेटा के एक सिंहावलोकन है.
hin.dash_paragraph2_text: अमान्य डेटा की रिपोर्ट है कि कब और कहाँ तुम दिखा कर, Dash मुख्य साइट पर परिलक्षित होते हैं कि अंतराल की व्याख्या करने में सक्षम हो जाएगा.
hin.dash_paragraph3_text: Dash देश विशिष्ट नहीं है तो आप सभी देशों में उपलब्ध प्रकाशक आँकड़ों के सभी पोर्टल में शामिल देखने में सक्षम हो जाएगा. यह कई प्राप्तकर्ता देशों में गतिविधियों की रिपोर्ट है कि कई प्रकाशकों रहे हैं इस तथ्य को समायोजित करने के लिए है.
hin.dash_paragraph4_text: Dash में मौजूदा समय में पहुंचा जा सकता हैhttp://d-portal.org/ctrack.html?#view=dash. Dash एक नई सुविधा है और अभी भी विकसित किया जा रहा है.
hin.dash_title_text: Dash : d-portal.org के लिए प्रकाशकों के आँकड़े
hin.discover_paragraph1_text: Explore एक नई सुविधा भारी विकास के अंतर्गत वर्तमान में है। dstore के समर्थन से और Q, यह उपयोगकर्ताओं को विशाल IATI डाटाबेस के माध्यम से फिल्टर करने के लिए एक सरल खोज इंटरफेस प्रदान करेगा।
hin.discover_paragraph2_text: वर्तमान में हम intuitiveness और <खोज> के प्रयोज्य के बारे में प्रतिक्रिया मांग कर रहे हैं। एक जाना है और हमें के माध्यम से Github मंच एक नया मुद्दा जोड़कर अपनी राय भेजने या, यदि आप पसंद करते हैं, support@iatistandard.org के माध्यम से संपर्क में हैं। हम आपको क्या लगता है कि सुनना अच्छा लगेगा!
hin.dlogs_paragraph1_text: रात के आयात से उत्पन्न डी-पोर्टल डेटाबेस के आंकड़े और आलेख इसे डी-पोर्टल पर प्रकाशित आईएटीआई गतिविधियों की बढ़ती संख्या को ट्रैक करने के लिए बनाया गया था
hin.dquery_paragraph1_text: पूर्ण डेटाबेस के लिए केवल SQL इंटरफ़ेस पढ़ा जाता है, dquery तकनीकी उपयोगकर्ताओं को XML, JSON, HTML और CSV स्वरूपों में डेटा डाउनलोड करने के लिए सभी IATI डेटा पॉपुलेटिंग d-portal और विकल्पों तक पहुँच प्रदान करता है।
hin.dquery_paragraph2_text: पूर्ण डेटाबेस के लिए केवल SQL इंटरफ़ेस पढ़ा जाता है, dquery तकनीकी उपयोगकर्ताओं को XML, JSON, HTML और CSV स्वरूपों में डेटा डाउनलोड करने के लिए सभी IATI डेटा पॉपुलेटिंग d-portal और विकल्पों तक पहुँच प्रदान करता है।
hin.dstore_paragraph_text: dstore वास्तविक समय प्रश्नों में उपयोग के लिए एक अनुकूलित nodejs + PostgreSQL + SQLite संस्करण के साथ IATI Registry सब्सिडी.
hin.explore_paragraph1_text: नीचे अपने डेटा का पता लगाने के लिए एक देश या प्रकाशक उठाओ.
hin.explore_paragraph2_text: केवल देशों और IATI को प्रकाशित आंकड़ों के साथ प्रकाशकों की खोज के लिए उपलब्ध हैं.
hin.faq_explore_a1_text:
EXPLORE is made up of two parts – a series of filters, and a freetext box.

1. Filters

These are a selection of filters relating to the IATI Standard allowing users to choose and refine the IATI data they want to explore.

2. Freetext

This is a freetext box allowing users to search for themes and topics, and specific activities published to IATI.
hin.faq_explore_a2_text: The EXPLORE feature is on the front page of d-portal.org and helps users find activities published to the IATI Standard based on keywords - it was originally developed to help people who wanted to find information on specific humanitarian crises.
hin.faq_explore_a3_text:
Select multiple filters from across the dropdowns. As you build a query using these filters the space underneath the filters will populate with an indication of how many activities are available to view based on your selections.

You can then click ‘Explore Results’ to find out more about those activities.
hin.faq_explore_a4_text:
Recipient Country and Reporting Organisation

The organisations that have published to the IATI Standard, and the countries where funds have gone to as published within IATI data.

Sector Group and Sector

The numeric codes and names to describe sectors within the OECD DAC CRS, as used within the IATI Standard.

Activity Status

The numeric codes and names within the IATI activity status field.

Year Range

Years from 1960 to ‘present year + 2’.

More filters

The numeric codes and names within the IATI activity status field. Click on Glossary to find out more about individual filters.
hin.faq_explore_a5_text:
Type in one or more keywords and press enter to see how many activities have been found.

Click ‘Explore Results’ to see lists, graphs and maps allowing further exploration of the data.

Refine your search by adding multiple words – e.g. ‘Hurricane Matthew’ will find more refined (fewer) results than ‘Hurricane’.
hin.faq_explore_a6_text: Clicking ‘Explore Results’ provides results in the usual d-portal format (stats and charts which you can explore by clicking through to tables).
hin.faq_explore_a7_text: This searches the Title and Description fields within all published IATI activities.
hin.faq_explore_a8_text: EXPLORE is adapted for English plural nouns - e.g. typing ‘Refugee’ will include results for ‘Refugees’.
hin.faq_explore_a9_text: The COVID-19 button follows the IATI Publishing Guidance. It currently searches the database for COVID-19 in title and description fields and looks for the relevant codes in the humanitarian-scope element.

hin.faq_general_a13_text:
Data that is marked as invalid IATI xml when using the Validator.

Mismatch between ‘Identifier’ in organisation’s profile in the IATI Registry, and reporting-org in that organisation’s data – this will show zeroes in the organisation’s data until the two are matched.

Transaction type code not present.

Not using either Disbursements or Expenditure in transaction type field.

Country and Sector graphs are displayed by adding up Transaction type codes 3 (Disbursement) and 4 (Expenditure) so activities without transactions or the right transaction type codes will not have these graphs.

Dates in incorrect format in the data.

Activities without end date are not shown on the list of projects ending soon or any lists that need an end date to order them.

The map section will not be shown if there are no activities with longitude and latitude data.

Illogical dates such as activity end date before activity start date.

No data relevant to the year being viewed on a pie chart or table (eg where a pie chart shows 2024 data and data published only relates to 2023).

If updating your Registry profile only, changes will show after the weekly full import (each weekend) as d-portal only updates nightly the data that has been changed in the xml.
hin.faq_general_a1_text: A view of all IATI (International Aid Transparency Initiative) data by recipient country or organisation, comparable with latest OECD DAC CRS (Creditor Reporting System) data.
hin.faq_general_a2_text: IATI and CRS data (see below for more information).
hin.faq_general_a3_text: The International Aid Transparency Initiative - IATI is a voluntary, multi-stakeholder initiative that seeks to improve the transparency of aid, development, and humanitarian resources in order to increase their effectiveness in tackling poverty.
hin.faq_general_a4_text: The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development’s Development Assistance Committee Creditor Reporting System - which contains Official Development Assistance data.
hin.faq_general_a5_text:
The IATI data comes from the IATI Registry.

The CRS data comes from CRS tables and stored on Github.
hin.faq_general_a6_text:
Organisations report their IATI data at varying degrees of detail, and data is updated and improved all the time by reporting organisations. If a reporting organisation only publishes data for 2023, it won’t appear in 2024 columns/charts etc.

d-portal attempts to only reflect what is in the data and does not make corrections to data or information published to IATI, with only small exceptions to make the site user-friendly*

See also information about data quality (Afghanistan used as example)
hin.faq_general_a7_text:
Zeroes may denote issues with data quality (eg codes, dates, etc which are incompatible with the IATI Standard). There will shortly be links to the organisation’s page on the IATI dashboard to investigate specific data quality issues.

Dashes show that that donor/organisation is not currently an IATI Reporting Organisation.
hin.faq_general_a8_text:
IATI data is updated every night (importing any data which has changed from the previous day) and a full import is done each weekend - in each instance the data is pulled from the IATI Registry.

CRS data is downloaded annually when it becomes available and then stored in Github.
